title: [Paper] Transformers at a Fraction
professor: co authors: Rucha Joshi, Nidhi Tiwari and Prof. Subhankar Mishra
description: In this paper we showed how quaternion transformers perform better than real transformers on extreme sparse conditions.

title: Importance Sampling and Machine Learning Approach for Classical Ising Model
description: Generated a lot of lattice configuration given some temperature and some hamiltonian (Ising Model here). Now we plan to use machine learning to predict a lot of physical quantities which willl bypass the need ton run the simulation

title: [Paper] Large Neural Networks at a Fraction
professor: co authors: Adhilsha A and Prof. Subhankar Mishra
description: Our paper on veryfying lottery ticket hypothesis on large quaternion models and large datasets got accepted in the Northern Lights Deep Learning conference (Norway) 2024. We showed how quaternion models retain good performance on more drastic pruning than real models.

title: Microsoft Academic Partnership Grant (MAPG) 2023
description: Recipient of the prestigious Microsoft Academic Partnership Grant (MAPG) 2023 for our project on optimizing complex neural networks with fewer parameters. Led by Prof. Subhankar Mishra in collaboration with PhD student Rucha Joshi, we aim to contribute to groundbreaking advancements in efficient neural network architectures.

title: Improvement on the Quaternion-based models: extension to larger datasets and models
description: Explored lottery ticket hypothesis on large quaternion-based ResNets for Cifar100 & Imagenet. Discovered superior accuracy retention on pruning compared to real models. Valuable insights for efficient deep learning architectures.

title: Came first in the ML4SCI Hackathon
description: Participated in Higgs Challenge of ML4SCI competition with 11M data points dataset. Employed ensemble model (5 NNs + XGBoost) to predict Higgs boson presence, achieving ROC AUC of 0.88 on test set. Came first. Collaborated with Diptarko Chakroborty.

title: Quantum Computation Internship
description: First Internship: Explored quantum computation fundamentals and various aspects. Read various research papers and pursued independent activities. Focused on Quantum Robotics paper, proposed innovative solutions in report. Enhanced research and problem-solving skills.

title: Quantum Computation Course
description: Summer course on Quantum Computation and Quantum Information by IISER Tirupati and Qkrishi. Covered theory and IBM Quantum Experience. Project on Attacking QKD Protocols. Demonstrated QKD algorithms (BB84 and E91) with Flask and Qiskit on multiple network devices.

title: Building a Drone
description: Built an autonomous drone with RTC support. Constructed the drone from scratch using aluminium box pipes, switchboard sunmica plates, and 3D-printed parts. Utilized pixhawk 4 as the flight controller. Features manual and pre-programmed GPS-guided flight modes. Potential for further development and learning.

title: Machine Learning Internship
description: Focused on NLP and Information Retrieval in ML. Explored NLP steps, problems, and solutions. Learned scoring algorithms for document sorting in a corpus based on query relevance. Achieved MAP value of 0.21 for AILA dataset (previous max was 0.14).

title: PyaR Seminar 2021
description: Here we learned the python programming language and how it can be used with Jupyter Notebook. We also learned the basics of astronomical data analysis using libraries like Numpy, Pandas, matplotlib etc. We were also briefed about some clustering algorithms used frequently in this field.
